project.teaser: H2-enriched direct reduction (DR) is the key decarbonisation technology for integrated steelworks mentioned in pathways of all major steel producers. Natural gas driven DR is established in industry mostly outside Europe but there are no experiences with high H2 enrichment >...
project.objective: H2-enriched direct reduction (DR) is the key decarbonisation technology for integrated steelworks mentioned in pathways of all major steel producers. Natural gas driven DR is established in industry mostly outside Europe but there are no experiences with high H2 enrichment > 80%. H2 based reduction is no principal issue but endothermic and the influences on morphology, diffusion and effective kinetics are not known. Also properties and movement of particles in the reactor are not know and issues like sticking cannot be excluded. Probably, temperature distribution and flow of solids and gas will be clearly different. No reliable prognosis is possible yet, in particular with regard to local permeability, process stability and product quality of industrial size furnaces with higher loads on the particles and larger local differences. Many activities are initiated for first industrial demonstration of H2-enriched DR but they will not close many of these knowledge gaps. MaxH2DR provides missing knowledge and data of reduction processes. A world-first test rig determines pellet properties at conditions of industrial H2 enriched DR furnaces and a physical demonstrator shows the linked solid and gas flow in shaft furnaces. This will be combined with digitals models including the key technology DEM-CFD to provide a hybrid demonstrator able to investigate scale-up and to optimise DR furnace design and operating point. This sound basis will be used to optimise the process integration into existing process chains. Simulation tools will be combined to a toolkits that covers impacts of product properties on downstream processes as well as impacts on gas and energy cycles. Thus, promising process chains, sustainable and flexible, will be achieved for different steps along the road to decarbonisation. The digital toolkits will support industrial demonstration and implementation and strengthen digitisation and competitiveness of the European steel industry.
project.title: Maximise H2 Enrichment in Direct Reduction Shaft Furnaces
project.keywords: Hydrogen, Direct Reduction, Demonstration, Iron, Steel, Digitisation, Carbon Direct Avoidance

result.title: Digital demonstration of granular particle movement and gas flow by coupled DEM/CFD simulations
result.description: The granular particle movement computations by the DEM/CFD model will be validated against some selected physical demonstration experiments. This Deliverable is the result of Task 2.2.

result.title: Procedures for the determination of physical properties of DR raw materials, intermediate and products
result.description: Report on bed-scale experiments on two different pellet types. This Deliverable is a result of Task 1.2.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: FAIR principles are implemented for and between each partner. This Deliverable is a result of Task 4.4. The deliverable will also consider the Personal Data collected via surveys and interviews.

result.title: Benchmarking of developed steelmaking chain models
result.description: Benchmarking of the tools of the multipurpose toolkit based on simulations of a standard integrated steelworks. This Deliverable is the result of Task 3.1.

details.authors: Ismael Matino, Valentina Colla, Antonella Vignali

result.title: Dissemination and Communication strategy
result.description: Development of a dedicated Dissemination and Communication strategy. This Deliverable is the result of Task 4.2.

result.title: Comprehensive Overview of the Project
result.description: Set-up of an Comprehensive Overview of the Project. This Deliverable is a result of Task 5.3.

result.title: Operating Solutions to Improve the Direct Reduction of Iron Ore by Hydrogen in a Shaft Furnace
Pellet reduction kinetic model adapt in multiparticle reactor models
result.description: Report presenting first results of the UL, BFI and RUB reactor models after the introduction of the kinetic sub-model. This Deliverable is the result of Task 1.4.

details.authors: Emiliano Salucci, Antonio D’Angelo, Vincenzo Russo, Henrik Grénman, Henrik Saxén,

result.title: Safety and risk assessment
result.description: This deliverable will be focussing on safety and risks in plant operation to prepare for the ethics check foreseen in M26. This Deliverable is a result of Task 5.5.

result.title: Mathematical optimization modeling for scenario analysis of integrated steelworks transitioning towards hydrogen-based reduction

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - MaxH2DR (Maximise H2 Enrichment in Direct Reduction Shaft Furnaces)
result.teaser: In standard Direct Reduction (DR) shafts, the H2 content in the reduction gas is approximately 60 Vol-% or lower and no industrial or demonstration-scale results were published yet for DR with strong H2 enrichment (H2>80 Vol-%), the so-called “H2-enriched DR”. Although...

result.title: Experiments of reduction kinetics of iron ore raw materials
result.description: Report on the reduction experiments at various scales, their results and significance. This Deliverable is the result of Task 1.1.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
